pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:5.1: 11. The training rule on laughing loudly
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were walking in inhabited areas, laughing loudly. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:7.1: “‘I will not laugh loudly while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:8.1: Walking in an inhabited area, one should not laugh loudly.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:8.2: If a monk, out of disrespect, laughs loudly while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:9.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:10.1: The first training rule is finished.
